page.title: 15PUBS IN CASTLE CARROCK
page.content:
There are two public houses in Castle Carrock. The "Weary Sportsman" has been an inn for over 200 years and was originally a coaching inn, as shown by the old stables and outhouses at the rear. The interior boasts oak beams and much brassware.
The "Duke of Cumberland" has also been a public house for many years, although it was converted from a house, and is decorated in an old-style manner.
Darts and dominoes are major attractions at the "Weary", whereas the "Duke" concentrates more on providing special evenings with food, music, and decoration all related, i.e. Italian Evening. Both pubs are patronised by people from many miles around.
